    • Method Detail

      • setReplaceNonAsciiCharactersWithHtmlCharacterReferences

        public void setReplaceNonAsciiCharactersWithHtmlCharacterReferences(boolean value)
        Configures whether all non-ASCII characters (code point 128 and above) that will be written should be silently converted into "HTML character entity references", or, if an HTML character entity reference does not exist for the code point, into a numeric character reference.

        Examples:

        "ä"
        "ä"
        "&auml;"
        "?"
        "&#4660;"

        By default, this conversion is on.

      • l

        public void l(java.lang.String... lines)
        Description copied from class: NoTemplate
        Writes the given lines, and a line separator after each line.

        Invoking this method is equivalent with: 

           for (String line : lines) {
       this.p(line);
       this.l();
   }
        Overrides:

      • esc

        public static java.lang.String esc(java.lang.String rawText)
        Replaces the five HTML special characters with "character entities".

        Notice that non-ASCII characters (like "ä") need not (and should not) be printed as character entities by the template, because they are already automatically converted.

        Predefined entities in XML
        NameCharacterUnicode code point (decimal)Description
        quot"U+0022 (34)double quotation mark
        amp&U+0026 (38)ampersand
        apos'U+0027 (39)apostrophe (apostrophe-quote)
        lt<U+003C (60)less-than sign
        gt>U+003E (62)greater-than sign
        See Also:
        setReplaceNonAsciiCharactersWithHtmlCharacterReferences(boolean)
